I loved this game but, after looking back, I can't recommend it. The developers continuously made the game worse while neglecting the issues that the community thought were important. It can be fun with friends as long as you don't take the game too seriously. I might come back to playing someday if the game is fixed.

Bel gioco sempre in progresso ed aggiornamento, l'unica pecca è, come in tutti i giochi multiplayer, il lavoro di squadra e se ti capitasse di giocare con gente scarsa o che trolla volontariamente ti tocca perdere il game a prescindere dalla tua bravura.
Consiglio agli sviluppatori di inserire anche la chat vocale, la quale manca, e la possibilità di mutarla in qualsiasi momento.
Ottimo gioco per gli appassionati di film horror che vogliono passare il tempo.

너네 날 너무 싫어하는거 아니냐!? ~ 현실에선 무쌍의 살인마였던 내가 이세계에선 초☆찐따 ~

이 게임은 엔티티라는 이세계의 악마에게 끌려온 1명의 살인마가 4명의 생존마에게 괴롭힘을 당하는 게임입니다.
뉴비를 위한 랭크시스템이요? 물론 있지요 근데 너한텐 적용안되요. 노란랭크가 빨랭을 만나 사정없이 괴롭혀집니다.
평소 내가 M이었다. 혹은 EZ충들에게 티배깅을 받고 싶었다. 혹은 욕먹는 걸 즐긴다 하는 사람들에겐 강력 추천!
철권의 뒤를 잇는 맞아가면서 배우는 게임. 참고로 내가 살인마인데 생존마가 때리는 게 더 많아요.
판자에 눈뽕, 칼찌, 파로마까지 맵상에 있는 모든 오브젝트들로 골라 쳐맞는 게임.
이 게임에서 당신의 친구는 오직 갈고리뿐입니다.
지금 당장 구매해서 왕따의 기분을 느껴보세요.
たのしくゲームやってます。キラーに対するあおりが多いですがうまくなれば気になりません。うまくなりたいですｗ

Dead by Daylight is probably the ultimate game of cat and mouse, with a kick ass horror movie aesthetic.
They keep adding more awesome content and the game just keeps getting more varied.

I'm hoping one day the developers can find a way to add Chucky the living doll to the game but who knows what they've got up their sleeves.
I'm a bit worried that the DLC is getting a bit extensive and may overwhelm new players, but as someone who's played it on and off for a while I'm used to it.

If you have the time, energy, patience, and/or friends, I highly recommend grabbing this game during a sale. If you don't have any of the previously stated things, I don't recommend this game. Dbd has an incredibly toxic and competitive player base so I heavily recommend playing with friends. But trust me, after a while, you'll get the hang of it and get the satisfaction of mori-ing a survive-with-friends group with your Prestige 3 smartface bubba (please keep in mind Leatherface is one of the easiest killers to bully in the game). If you're looking for some teachable perk advice, start leveling up claudette, nea, and meg first if your focusing on survivor gameplay and focus on leveling up leatherface and the Pig first if your focusing on killer gameplay.

Dead By daylight (DBD) what a game, this is a roller coaster with its up and down. It is not perfect mainly with needing to pay for majority of better parts of the game (With branded names it IS understandable that they need to pay for it). Either playing survivors with friends up to 4 in total, including yourself, to fix 5 generators to leave via 2 exit gates or a hatch for 1 special person (or with a key, with load-outs) or being a killer and trying to murder and not let anyone escape. 

Good game for team bonding or really to make you think, I suggest watching pro players play to learn a more passive way. (Otzdarva is a good place, he is where i learned to be good and learn really good tips, good kind streamer).

Learning different load-outs comes over time and with the in store shrine of secrets, you can spend shards (you get these from leveling up) to get good perks and not pay real money or with already unlocked characters, get their teachable perks just by leveling them up and able to use perks with any of your characters.

The matchmaking is a bit messed up with ranks mixing at higher to low ones but normally, you should be okay with playing with people on your level in the beginning, around rank 10 (lowest is 20, highest 1) is when it starts getting funky.

I recommend trying to just have fun and try new play styles, you have good days and bad days.

Gen-rush and loop, sacrifice and chase. good luck!

Probably my favorite multiplayer game to date. Offers much more then your everyday 1st person shooter title and I loved that it still has a competitive aspect to it. Play with friends and try to survive or play the killer and test your skills. If you were a fan of scary games and want something to play definitely pick this game up

Its a fine game if you were already well experienced. If you are not, the game seems to intentionally attempt to crush newer players with a online ranking system that consistently prefers matching hyper experienced players against newer players. This would be less of an issue if said experience did not directly lead to the gain of many particularly overpowering abilities. Leaving many new players struggling to win matches (or frankly have any impact at all). Overall, the game is fun for those who have been here the longest and amassed a collection of powerful items and perks, though, it is largely ignorant of the imbalance in online matches that is crushing many newcomers to the player-base.

Got into the game with friends as survive with friends, but ended up enjoying playing killer as well when I didn't have friends to group with! Great game for solo or with friends, the perks give almost unlimited re-playability with the different builds you can do!

I have played this game quite extensively playing both killer and survivor. I have a good grasp of the perks, strategies, and maps. I do enjoy the game- for the most part. As a survivor, there is an ebb and flow of tension as you go between being chased and completing objectives. The pressure is always on as killer, however. As a survivor, you are 1 v 1 with the killer. As a killer, you are 1 v 4. With that in mind, here are my grievances:

1. Toxicity. As a killer, teabagging and dragging out the end-game when they should just leave. As a survivor, you're often "tunneled" and camped in the lower ranks. It can be difficult to gain rank where killers don't do this as much because your fellow survivors are, for the most part, inefficient. End game chat can be pleasant, but often is not. I am guilty of this too. You tend to become a monster.

2. Map design - There are issues with some maps, and quite a number are killer-dependent. For example, if you're in an indoor map, it is extremely difficult to play a killer like Huntress.

3. Killer bugs - There are some bugs that the developers have ignored that have existed for over a year. For example, the Nurse "blink bug". In addition, the hitboxes for Huntress's axes can be really wonky (sometimes in your favor, sometimes not). Continuing off Nurse, there were pervasive issues for a long time with Blinking through tires, haystacks, certain rocks, under the pier in the Swamp map, in the hallway in the Silent Hill map, around basements (sometimes you blink to the basement when you're looking ground level), in the basement (there are corners you can't blink through at all)- to name a few. In addition, when Victor pounces on an incline, he goes two feet and is vulnerable for Survivors to kick/kill him. 

4. Grab mechanics - Often as a killer, if you grab a survivor as they are entering/exiting a locker or off a generator, it will "cancel". I believe this has to do with favoring Survivor latency. However, it is extremely annoying as killer- especially when they are full health and now you have to hit them once, they get a speed boost, loop for a while, down them, and then carry them to hook when you should've just grabbed them and got to immediately carry them to hook. 

5. Censor filter - This is a new advent by the game's development team. While it isn't my biggest criticism, it is the most damning. Utterly, horribly broken. Phrases that are perfectly fine are filtered. Even one of the killer's names (Meyers) is filtered. Phrases related to in-game mechanics are filtered such as "picked her/him up" when referring to literally picking them up off the ground. The worst part is that you can't turn it off. Seriously. You are playing an M rated game to be treated like a ####ing child by the developers. It's insulting.

6. The developers are unresponsive - They are not very responsive to the community. In fact, in the face of criticism, the lead for the game at one time recommended that others play another game on live stream (to his cohort's visible dismay). Way back when, he played as a killer and was visibly frustrated at the number of pallets and "infinite" loops in the game. The game is very survivor favored by the developers. 

7. Hackers - While you don't run into these every day, it is common enough to make you wonder how on earth they don't have a good anti-cheat mechanic. I mean, they have SOMETHING, but it's really not good. Makes for funny YouTube videos sometimes, though. Just not fun to play against. 

8. Pallets - too freaking many.

All in all, the game was fun for a while, and I've played for about...I think 4 years? But the lack of concern by the developers, or lack of transparency, in treating known issues and allowing them to persist for YEARS is what made me leave this negative review. I am a little sad because I want to be as passionate about this game as when I was a new player. At the same time, I've played this game long enough to hope this review catches someone's attention to either inspire change or prevent them from gaining any more money until they get their crap together.

EDIT (6/14/2021): Consistent disconnect from game servers. Results in auto-ban.
EDIT (6/20/2021): Dealt with the Nurse "blink bug" a lot today. Yesterday dealt with the bug for clown where his power sometimes doesn't hinder/slow survivors. Also discovered a new bug with Blight where he has to use his basic attack before he can use his special (Rush) ability. And my game just crashed...please don't buy this game. 
EDIT (6/22/2021): Tried to use a meme build today where I used Insideous at the exit gates. Supposedly, it makes you undetectable. However, the survivors could hear me behind the closed exit gate because of default killer noise (breathing) while I was in "undetectable" status. This is also an issue with other killers like Demogorgon, who is supposed to be undetectable when using his ability, but his footsteps are extremely loud and distinguishable. Please don't buy this game.
EDIT (7/26/2021) Nurse still has the blink bug. Been like 2 months now.
EDIT (7/28/2021) Supposed recent update to fix Blight/Clown.
EDIT (8/1/20201) This will be my last edit. At 754 hours, I F***ING QUIT. That has become the only cure.

jogo muito bom e divertido cm mecanicas digamos que inovadoras e frequentemente atualizado, cm uma pegada em terro, o objetivo da partida é abrir um portao para escapar de um local estranho (mapas podem variar dependendo da partida) para isso os jogadores tem que se juntar para ligar os geradores espalhados por ali, enquanto outro jogador é um assassino cujo o objetivo é basicamente te matar, o jogo é focado no online e é por isso que eu gosto tanto dele, a comunicaçao é muito importante no jogo ainda mais quando se esta cm amigos oq deixa o jogo mais divertido ainda, msm que nao tenha chat escrito durante a partida ainda sim a emotes e outras formas de se comunicar cm os outros jogadores,é um jogo muito bom e eu recomendo muito, alguns assassinos realmente dao medo cuidado :), o lado negativo desse jogo porem é que ele é completamente pagavel, absolutamente tudo nesse jogo é pra comprar oq é um pessimo ponto mas fora isso o jogo é muito bom

A deeply unbalanced game. The devs pander to survivor players, giving them overwhelming advantages once they understand the game. This has led to many survivors developing a God complex, which has in turn cultivated the most toxic community of any game I've ever played. My bad review stays until they balance the game, which it seems will never happen as the survivors outnumber the killers so the devs want to appease the majority of their player base as well as make the game easier to new players.
